column4: Is there any way to set the video-out as the primary display device?
If the onboard video is stuffed?
is the video-out PCI or what?
erm, perhaps I am misunderstanding. When you say video-out you mean what?
do you mean the laptop monitor is broken and you want to use an externel monitor?

The VGA output port on the back. Basically the laptop screen is stuffed, and we are having trouble getting things to use the external monitor. Currently using Knoppix, but X fails. Downloading Ubuntu right now to try that.
okay. well ubuntu should appear on both screens
of course :), however you should get a terminal on both screens/monitors.
Yeah, we have a terminal already.
The user is not used to Linux or CLI though.
okay, what video card do you have?
okay, so you have a nvidia card that you want to go the external monitor correct?
Yeah, it gives itself a 127.0 address, and the router doesn't see it at all.
hmm? When you're connected to ethernet by a default ubuntu install it should assign you an IP address unless you have some odd router settings
Right now it's in Knoppix. Still downloading Ubuntu. And yes, it should be able to get an IP.
